title: Tens of thousands sign petition calling for harsher sentence for Kmart kidnapper
text:
A campaign demanding a harsher sentence for the Kmart sex predator who abducted a seven-year-old girl is rapidly gaining momentum.

Sterling Mervyn Free, 27, was jailed for eight years on October 11 in Brisbane District Court for kidnapping the child before molesting her in bushland, but may walk free in less than two years.

The change.org petition started by Fighters Against Child Abuse Australia has nearly reached the 50,000 signature goal.

A petition demanding a stronger sentence for the Kmart sex predator Sterling Free who abducted a seven-year-old girl is rapidly attracting tens of thousands of signatures

Free leads the little girl away from Brisbane's Westfield North Lakes, in footage shown to the court

'This could mean that in less than two years this monster could be back on the streets, posing a threat to our children, our society,' the petition read.

'Yet the courts are considering releasing this perpetrator into society.

'This is yet another example of how our legal system has very little to do with justice for survivors of crime and even less to do with protecting our children from known threats.'

The little girl was searching the toy aisles for a present while her mother stood nearby, when the predator led her away

The petition is pleading for attorney-general Yvette D'Ath to repeal Free's parole period.

'It's time that the legal system addresses our concerns not just by labelling them guilty but also ensuring that criminals serve their due time,' the petition read.

'8 years behind bars cannot bring justice to the little girl who has to live with the memory of the heinous crime for the rest of her life.'

Free, a father of twin girls, lured the victim in a Kmart toy isle, before kidnapping her and driving her to a bush where she was sexually assaulted.

On the day he was sentenced, a Queensland judge described his crime as 'abhorrent' and 'every parent's worst nightmare'.
